title: Covid-19 Cuts Short Blinkenâ€™s Effort to Rally Asian States Against China
sub_head: The Secretary of State dropped planned meetings in Thailand after a journalist tested positive
body:
Secretary of State Antony Blinken ended a diplomatic tour of Southeast Asia on Wednesday after at least one person traveling with him tested positive for the coronavirus, cutting short an effort to rally friendly Asian nations to join Washington in confronting an assertive China.
Mr. Blinken, State Department staff and journalists were visiting Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, when a journalist tested positive for Covid-19, State Department spokesman Ned Price said. Mr. Blinken and his senior staff tested negative. The positive coronavirus test halted plans for meetings in Thailand.
